data.title: I’m all in on adopting Mondo
meta_keywords: I’m all in on adopting Mondo
data.meta_description: I’m all in on adopting Mondo - Don’t care if this dude was here for one semester. He will go down as one of the greatest athletes ever.
data.text:
Posted by lsutiger2

Baton Rouge

Member since Oct 2008

6361 posts

Don’t care if this dude was here for one semester. He will go down as one of the greatest athletes ever.

Posted by MikeTheTiger71

Member since Dec 2021

3086 posts

to lsutiger2

His mom, dad and brother were all Tigers too. Of course he’s a Tiger. He made that clear when he made his comments about the stadium reminding him of the roar of the crowd in Death Valley. That level of connection to LSU didn’t come from one year as a student alone.

Posted by SportsGuyNOLA

New Orleans, LA

Member since May 2014

17582 posts

to lsutiger2

He is 100% LSU

He is a lock on the LSU Mt.Rushmore with Shaq, Burrow, and The Pistol

Posted by tigerbait2010

PNW

Member since May 2006

29728 posts

to lsutiger2

So kind of you to allow mondo the privilege of being an LSU tiger. I’m sure his Death Valley reference in the press conference watched by many millions can finally live up to the contributions of your LSU degree wow

Posted by la_birdman

Northern GA via Lake Charles

Member since Feb 2005

31107 posts

to tigerbait2010

quote:

So kind of you to allow mondo the privilege of being an LSU tiger.

Is he not one? He ran track for LSU, correct?

The amount of hate this kid gets on here is ridiculous.

Some of y'all are acting like he's representing some terrorist organization.

Get over yourselves. The guy went to LSU, so did his brother Antoinne.

He threw a shoutout to LSU after his pole vault performance.

Can't just be happy for the guy.

This post was edited on 8/8/24 at 1:42 am

Posted by Cuthbert13

Member since Apr 2024

52 posts

to lsutiger2

In 6 months no one here will even remember him or speak about him.

Only reason this is the case now is no football.

Posted by Geaux Guy

Member since Dec 2018

5520 posts

to Cuthbert13

quote:

In 6 months no one here will even remember him or speak about him. Only reason this is the case now is no football.

Well, he’s up there with ABBA and Björn Borg in Sweden. He must have made the right decision.

Posted by Boudreauboudreaugoly

Land of the Rice n Son

Member since Oct 2017

1525 posts

to la_birdman

quote:

Is he not one? He ran track for LSU, correct?

Well, if you call running down a run way toward a pole vault pit with an 18’ pole “running track” , then I guess yes, he did “run track” for LSU.

Posted by Fightin Okra

Member since Nov 2016

5728 posts

to lsutiger2

When he is recognized at a football game this year, the crowd will go wild including guys who are on this site bashing him.

quote:

Cuthbert13

quote:

In 6 months no one here will even remember him or speak about him.

to Boudreauboudreaugoly

quote:

Well, if you call running down a run way toward a pole vault pit with an 18’ pole “running track” , then I guess yes, he did “run track” for LSU.

Probably thought you were being clever I am sure. The colloquialism of "running track" being used for athletes who are part of the track and field teams is older than you or I.

I quite like it when posters remove all doubt early into their posting so I don’t have to discover they’re a fool. Good job dude.

Posted by JimTiger72

Member since Jun 2023

6398 posts

to lsutiger2

quote:

He will go down as one of the greatest athletes ever.

True. Not for his career at LSU, but he is the best pole vaulter in the world.

NCAA indoor champion, runner up in outdoor, SEC indoor & outdoor champion still pretty damn good for 1 year. Of course we claim him as a Tiger.
